snippet: The disparities in the economies of Germany and France, visible in border towns between the two countries, have emerged as focal points of the French presidential campaign.
abstract: Disparities in the economies of Germany and France, visible in border towns between the two countries, have emerged as focal points of the French presidential campaign; unemployment in France is at a 12-year high and rising, and has become a major issue for Pres Nicolas Sarkozy, who is fighting for re-election; Germany’s unemployment rate, at 7.4 percent, is at its lowest point since reunification in 1991;

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The disparities in the economies of Germany and France, visible in border towns between the two countries, have emerged as focal points of the French presidential campaign.

headline.seo: Economic Disparities With Germany Shapes a French Election
headline.main: French-German Border Shapes More Than Territory
headline.print_headline: When a Border Shapes More Than Territory
